snippet: While Mayor Julián Castro of San Antonio and Representative Joaquin Castro have projected a fresh Latino face for the Democratic Party, some are concerned they are too politically cautious.
abstract: San Antonio Mayor Julian Castro faces off in televised debate against Dan Patrick, Republican candidate for Texas lieutenant governor, even though Castro is not officially running; Castro and his twin brother Rep Joaquin Castro have sought ways to stay on national radar since he became first Latino to give Democratic National Convention keynote address in 2012; some Democrats looking for strong, fresh candidates are worried that brothers are too politically cautious and suffer from a lack of Spanish language skills.
lead_paragraph: While Mayor Julián Castro of San Antonio and Representative Joaquin Castro have projected a fresh Latino face for the Democratic Party, some are concerned they are too politically cautious.

headline.main: Texas Twins Campaign, but They Aren’t Sure for What
headline.print_headline: Texas Twins Campaign, but Aren’t Sure for What
